stem: The public health nurse is reviewing the EHR for three clients presenting with flu-like symptoms and jaundice. Based on the documented serology and history, match each Hepatitis type with its correct transmission route and prevention profile.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Case A: 22y/o male recently returned from a humanitarian mission in a region with poor sanitation. Reports eating local raw vegetables. 
Case B: 40y/o female, healthcare worker, sustained a needle-stick injury from a patient with chronic liver disease. 
Case C: 55y/o male with a 20-year history of intravenous drug use; admits to sharing needles and syringes.

tabs.title: Laboratory Results
tabs.content:
### SEROLOGY 
- Client A: IgM anti-HAV: Positive 
- Client B: HBsAg (Surface Antigen): Positive 
- Client C: Anti-HCV: Positive; HCV RNA: Detected 

### LIVER ENZYMES 
- ALT: 1,200 U/L (High) 
- AST: 980 U/L (High) 
- Total Bilirubin: 4.2 mg/dL (High)

tabs.title: Immunization Record
tabs.content:
Client A: Received 2-dose series 5 years ago. 
Client B: Completed 3-dose series at start of employment. 
Client C: No immunization records found; patient states 'there isn't a vaccine for what I have.'

rows.text: Hepatitis A: (IgM anti-HAV Positive, Poor Sanitation Hx)
Hepatitis C: (HCV RNA Detected, IV Drug Use Hx)

rationale.correct: Hepatitis A is transmitted via the fecal-oral route (A=Anus/Eating) and has a vaccine. Hepatitis B (B=Blood/Bodily Fluids) has a vaccine. Hepatitis C (C=Chronic/Cirrhosis) is also blood-borne but CURRENTLY has no vaccine.
clinicalPearls: Hep A and E are the only ones with fecal-oral transmission.
Hep B is the only DNA-based hepatitis virus.
Post-exposure prophylaxis for Hep B includes both the vaccine and HBIG (Immune Globulin).

questionTrap.trap: Confusion between Hep B and Hep C vaccine availability.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that we screen for Hep C precisely because we can't vaccinate against it yet.

mnemonic.title: The Hepatitis 'Vowels'
mnemonic.expansion: A & E (Vowels) come from the Bowel (Fecal-Oral).
